page.title: 04TRANSPORT PROBLEMS IN HANLEY
page.content: In Hanley's town centre the one-way system has been congested because the Severn-Trent Water Authority have been laying new water mains.They have partly been laid because of the Eastern Bypass under construction.The route of this new road can now clearly be seen because of the derelictions,demolition and destruction.There are a lot of fumes,smoke and dust from the rubble and it is putting a different atmosphere into Hanley.Terraced homes have disappeared.The birthplace of Captain Smith of the Titanic in Jasper Street has been demolished and the home of Reginald Mitchell the Spitfire designer.History is disappearing. Some people believe the new road will help traffic and pedestrians in the city centre, while others look on and wonder.
